job_city: District of Columbia, USA, Remote; Maryland, USA, Remote; Virginia, USA, Remote
job_description: Datadog’s Public Sector Marketing team is seeking an experienced Partner Marketing Manager to build and scale co-marketing programs with our strategic public sector partners, including AWS, Carahsoft, systems integrators (SIs), and resellers to drive pipeline and brand impact. This individual will develop, execute, and optimize co-marketing campaigns and enablement programs that position Datadog as the observability and security platform of choice for U.S. Federal, State, Local, and Education (SLED) markets.This role requires knowledge of the public sector ecosystem, government procurement processes, and the unique compliance and security requirements (e.g., FedRAMP, GovRAMP). You will work cross-functionally with sales, product marketing, field marketing, alliances, and demand generation teams to ensure partner marketing efforts are aligned to Datadog’s growth goals in the public sector.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds, and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll DoLead partner go-to-market strategy by developing and executing joint marketing plans with key public sector partners (AWS, Carahsoft, systems integrators, resellers).Manage MDF through planning, approving, tracking, and optimizing partner marketing development fund investments for campaigns, events, and targeted digital programs.Own the end-to-end execution of partner-led and co-branded marketing activities, from planning to performance analysis.Create and maintain enablement resources including partner playbooks, battlecards, solution briefs, and co-branded partner collateral to position Datadog effectively with public sector audiences.Drive partner seller readiness through training sessions, workshops, and enablement programs that empower partners to articulate Datadog’s value in mission-critical environments.Develop customer success storytelling with partners by producing case studies and proof points that highlight government and education wins.Collaborate cross-functionally with Public Sector Sales, Field Marketing, Product Marketing, and Demand Generation teams to align campaigns, messaging, and market approach. Build relationships with partner marketing teams to maximize collaboration and program impact.Track and report performance using Salesforce, partner portals, and analytics to measure sourced / influenced pipeline, enablement adoption, and MDF ROI.Who You Are6+ years of experience in partner marketing, alliances marketing, or channel marketing, ideally with a SaaS or cloud technology company serving the public sector.Strong understanding of public sector sales cycles, procurement vehicles, and compliance requirements (FedRAMP, SEWP, GSA).Proven track record building co-marketing campaigns with hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP) and/or leading distributors / SIs in the public sector.Skilled at navigating complex partner organizations and building trusted relationships across marketing, sales, and alliance teams.Excellent written and verbal communicator, adept at translating technical concepts into mission-relevant messaging for government audiences.You work fluidly across multiple internal teams and external partners.Strong communication skills with both technical and executive-level audiences.You understand the mechanics of SaaS / cloud partner ecosystems, especially managing MDF and enabling co‑marketing efforts.Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Why Join Datadog Public Sector MarketingYou’ll join a fast-moving, data-driven team executing high-impact campaigns that help government agencies secure critical systems, modernize faster, and operate more efficiently. This role offers the opportunity to shape Datadog’s public sector partner marketing engine at a time of rapid growth, with significant impact on pipeline and market positioning. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive benefits packageNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase planContinuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and spaceBest in breed onboardingInternal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentallyFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$96,000—$128,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.Equal Opportunity at Datadog:Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. job_description: We are seeking an experienced Executive Assistant with at least 2+ years of experience to support senior executives. The ideal candidate will be proactive, highly organized and capable of managing complex schedules and administrative tasks. This role requires strong interpersonal skills, attention to detail and the ability to handle confidential information with discretion. At Datadog, Business Operations run the day-to-day operations for Datadog and help to keep our employees safe, happy and productive, which means every day is different. Business Operations work closely with leadership and employees to ensure that Datadog keeps scaling smoothly and remains a great place to work.Datadog is looking for an Executive Assistant who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment to provide exemplary support for executives located in New York. This highly visible and professional position requires diligent attention to detail, impeccable time management skills, and an ability to multitask. This role reports directly to the Team Lead, Executive Support.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Manage and maintain executive schedules, coordinate internal and external meetings, arrange calls, dinners, events, etc.Coordinate and manage projects and follow-up on action itemsAssist in the preparation of agendas and materials for meetingsWork with the Executive Support Team on projects related to new hires, events, office functions, socials, offsite meetings, etcWho You Are:2+ years of experience supporting multiple leaders and senior executivesTech-savvy with a strong interest in using technology to improve work efficiencyProficient in Google WorkspaceSomeone with high integrity who can maintain complete confidentiality on all business mattersEven-tempered, kind and respectful; able to remain calm under pressureAble to communicate clearly and concisely in, both verbally and in writingDetailed-oriented with strong organizational and time-management skillsA great multitasker and team playerComfortable working in a fast-paced, hyper-growth environmentDatadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.In lieu of a cover letter please answer the below questions in less than one page:A guest has been waiting for 15 minutes and the CEO is nowhere to be found. How do you handle the situation?Describe a time where you coordinated chaos to perfection.What apps/methods do you use to stay organized?LinkedIn account linkBenefits and Growth: Generous and competitive benefits packageNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase planContinuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and spaceBest in breed onboardingInternal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentallyFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. job_description: We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The Technical Solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers via multi-channel technical support, demos, and presentations. You’ll be joining a team and company where you will be challenged, but also will immediately witness your contributions to Datadog.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Engage with customers via multiple channels (ticketing system, live chat, and screensharing tools) to identify and resolve technical support requests while continuing to educate our clients on the use of the platformReproduce technical issues and dive into Datadog’s 600+ integrationsParticipate in product conversations with internal teams based on feedback from client interactionsAcquire expertise across all Datadog GovCloud product areas.Work from a Datadog office 3 - 5 days per week Who You Are:Experienced in multi-channel technical support at a SaaS company (2+ years of related experience)Experienced using SalesForce GovCloud Plus, Jira, Confluence, or similar softwareAn engineer with previous technical troubleshooting and/or programming experienceSelf-motivated, detail-attentive, and have a desire for continuous learning A critical thinker who defaults to a client-centric approachAn effective written and verbal communicatorA tinkerer with some programming experience and a basic knowledge of LinuxDatadog values people from all walks of life. job_description: We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The Technical Solutions (TS) team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. The Field CISOs are part of the larger Product Solutions Architecture (PSAs) organization and act as technical multipliers who build lasting, trusted relationships, bridging the gap between customer aspirations and our technology roadmap, enabling digital transformation and ensuring sustained growth for both our customers and our organization. Datadog is growing the Technical Solutions (TS) organization by seeking a customer-focused, industry specialized, and results-oriented Field CISO to join our high-growth organization and oversee our GTM technical strategy for the North America region with primary focus on Information Security.Key RelationshipsReports to the Head of Product Solutions Architecture. Partners closely with all Technical Solutions teams (Product Solutions Architecture, Sales Engineering, Technical Post Sales, Support Engineering) and other internal teams such as Product Management, Sales, Marketing, Global Information Security, Customer Success, Go-To-Market Strategy, Finance, People & Recruiting, and more.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Leadership: Demonstrate Datadog's platform as well as thought leadership in modern Security and Observability, emphasizing our advanced security solutions, industry best practices, and dedication to providing organizations with superior security posture and management of their at scale environments.Advisory: Be a trusted advisor to Sales leaders as well as customer and prospect CISOs and security executives on security ROI, value realization, and vulnerability analysis. Assist with security opportunity and adoption strategy for individual customers within their vertical of expertise.GTM: Identifies industry-specific security threats and trends and their impact during Customer engagements, feeding the top-of-funnel for Product, GTM, BVA, and Architecture teams. Co-create industry security solutions via collaboration with Product SAs and Product Management.C-Level: Strategically guide CISO/CIO/CTO/CEO-level customer and prospect executives in rationalizing their security adoption journey, investment, and operationalizing of security and observability.Collaboration: Collaborate with Product Solutions Architecture (PSA), Sales, Sales Engineering, and Marketing in providing high-quality security-focused technical resources to a broad audience of practitioners and economic buyers.Presentations: Lead security architecture and design engagements to demonstrate how Datadog meets the security needs of strategic customers. Participate in Executive Brief conversations in Datadog’s Executive Briefing Center (EBC) with high-profile customers and prospects about overall security architecture, Security Best Practices, and industry security trends.Hiring: Assist leadership in recruiting and hiring of top talent for the Product Solutions Architecture and Field CTO/CISO teams with a focus on security expertise. Who You Are:Industry Experience: Strong experience of at least 15+ years with Enterprise Security architecture at scale and ability to map modern security-centric architectures to real-world use cases, coupled with deep knowledge of the security and observability space, cloud and application security, as well as technological shifts in the information security space.Strategic Thinker: Able to think long-term and creatively about a wide variety of security and business challenges.Stakeholder Management: Experienced in interacting and influencing key security stakeholders (VP+ and CISO/CIO/CTO level) in large Enterprise organizations.Technologist: Hands-on technologist with a strong security background who gains credibility and establishes strong relationships at all levels of the organization.Presenter: Excellent customer-facing presentation skills for large audiences, comfortable discussing complex security details as well as with briefing executives or non-technical personas on security topics.Communicator: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to link security product functionality to business objectives, security value realization, and ROI.Travel: Able to travel via auto, train or air up to 50% of the timeEducation: Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field, Master’s degree preferredDatadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:Best-in-breed onboardingGenerous global benefitsIntra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingAn inclusive company culture, able to join our Community Guilds and Inclusion TalksBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$280,000—$380,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.Equal Opportunity at Datadog:Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. job_description: Datadog is seeking a Field Marketing Manager for the LATAM South (Chile, Argentina, Paraguay, Uruguay) region. This role reports into the Director, LATAM Marketing, based in Brazil.We are seeking an individual with a proven track record in field marketing, a passion for technology, and a dedication to exceeding goals—setting new standards of excellence within the field marketing domain. This candidate consistently applies a growth mindset to their multi-touch, multi-channel approach to driving key account engagement. Your strategic mindset revolves around pipeline development, focusing on how field channels contribute to the global field marketing strategy to yield high-quality leads with best-in-class conversion rates. Collaboration is your forte, as you enjoy working with sales and cross-functional teams to understand colleagues' objectives, KPIs and insights. Your deep market knowledge enables you to be a strategic partner across the GTM organisation.Although we still do not have an office in Chile, WeWork facilities are available to be used in all countries, as at Datadog, we place value in building relationships and work in collaboration with cross teams. What You’ll Do: Create regional field marketing plans utilising regional market knowledge in collaborating with the wider marketing team such as Demand gen, marketing operations and partner marketing to drive strategic planning with clear KPIs, goals, forecasts, workflows, and enablement plans.Gain a comprehensive understanding of our products, market positioning, competition, and Ideal Customer Profile (ICP). Utilise your strategic mindset to build, own, and execute a strategy that focuses on pipeline development for the sales team and awareness of Datadog in the LATAM South region. As a strategic partner across the GTM org, this role will keep the teams informed of the full marketing strategy, their actionable resources, and analysis on what is driving buyer interest in the region.Work with demand generation teams based in the US to regionalize content and optimise messaging for landing pages, email marketing, and paid ads for audience acquisition to regional events and drive engagement for digital campaigns. Develop and deploy field events/programs that deliver the right leads at the right time.Utilise your knowledge of field channels to optimise the regional field marketing strategy and evaluate the success of each program to help inform future plans and roadmaps. Use your solution-oriented approach and outstanding organisational skills to meet deadlines while balancing multiple projects, business partners, and priorities.Proactively collaborate with the partner, sponsored event, and customer event marketing teams, forging strong alliances to enhance existing programs. Integrate their events seamlessly into the overall field marketing strategy, aiming to maximise the ROI on current marketing expenditures. Who You Are: 3-5 years of relevant field marketing experience in B2B SaaS marketing to the enterprise.Native language skills in Spanish as well as exceptional oral, written, and presentation skills in English.Ability to travel up to 40% of the time.Ability to create regional marketing plans and communicate the plans to sales. Experience with CRM (Salesforce), Google Suite, project management and sales enablement workflows.Outstanding organisational skills, ability to follow through, and capable of meeting deadlines while balancing multiple projects and priorities.Passionate about and an expert in delivering compelling field event experiences.Stellar communication and relationship building skills that help you connect with a range of people, from entry-level employees to the C-suite. Apply a growth mindset towards our business, function and your development.Thrive on data and engage with systems to collect, analyse and share data relative to your programs for pipeline planning.Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:Generous and competitive benefits packageNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase planContinuous career development and pathing opportunitiesEmployee-focused best in class onboardingInternal mentor and cross-departmental buddy programFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.About Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. job_description: As a UX Designer on Datadog’s Marketing team, you will help shape the end-to-end experience of our website, one of the most important ways prospects, customers, and partners learn about us. You’ll design user journeys, wireframes, and UX flows that make complex information easy to navigate. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to our design system, and help build a modern, scalable site that supports global audiences and drives business impact.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds, and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do: Design clear, intuitive user journeys and information architecture across the website experiences Create user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and other UX specs that support collaboration with engineering, marketing, and content partnersConduct user research and usability behaviors to surface insights that improve clarity and flowDesign experiences that help users easily find information, understand our products, and navigate complex content with confidenceUse analytics, experimentation, and research insights to guide strategy, validate decisions, and refine patterns over timePartner with other designers and strengthen design culture through systematic thinking, visual craft, and clear narratives Who You Are: 6-8 years experience in UX design with a portfolio showing user journeys, wireframes, prototypes, and researchSkilled in design systems, accessibility, and responsive designAble to use analytics, research, and testing to guide decisions and refine experiencesA collaborative partner who works well with engineering, marketing, and other business teamsSomeone who thrives in iterative environments and is eager to do experimentation and large-scale web UXA forward-thinking designer who enjoys solving complex problems and simplifying technical information Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth:New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Competitive global benefitsAccess to internal learning programs, mentorship, and skill-building resourcesIntra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingAn inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community GuildsOpportunity to influence the UX direction of a high-traffic, global website that reaches millions of technical usersBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. job_title: Global Safety & Security Senior Manager - NYC
job_description: The Global Safety & Security Team falls under the Operations Division that runs many day-to-day operational functions that help keep our employees safe, happy and productive. We work closely with leadership and employees to ensure that Datadog continues to scale rapidly, yet smoothly, and remains a fantastic place to work.We’re seeking an experienced team member to join our growing global team and play a critical role in keeping Datadogs and its assets safe and secure. You will work directly with the Head of Global Safety & Security and cross-functional teams to support safety and security operations across the enterprise. Ideal candidates will be passionate about leadership, security operations, building programs, workplace health and safety, project management, customer service, and collaboration. This position is based in our NYC office and will require domestic and international travel. The role will focus particularly on developing our protective services, headquarters security, incident and crisis management programs.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Manage day-to-day global safety and security operations for Datadog’s regional offices in AMER, including its global HQ in NYC and assist with global safety and security initiatives.Oversee a variety of responsibilities, including investigations, health and safety compliance, security risk management, travel safety, event security, budgeting, crisis management, emergency response, property loss management, and global safety and security system management. Enforce Datadog’s security policies and regulations regionally.Document and disseminate security protocols under the guidance of the Head of Global Safety and Security. Develop enterprise-wide access control standards, policies, technical security solutions, safety protocols, emergency preparedness training, and liaise with local law enforcement in individual offices.Collaborate with various teams, including Office Operations, Real Estate, IT, Legal, Executive Assistants, Events and People teams. Maintain regular communication with stakeholders to ensure alignment on global safety and security initiatives, and ensure all teams are trained on emergency plans and incident response protocols.Execute daily operations and strategic initiatives for workplace safety and security, contract security personnel management, and response to incidents in Datadog offices.Identify long-term needs in terms of organizational structure, policies/procedures, and capital enhancements. Develop strategic plans to obtain executive approval, define objectives, secure resources, and execute key milestones.Provide assessments and briefings to leadership, ensuring understanding of corrective actions, their impact, and urgency.Facilitate tabletop exercises for regional offices focused on emergency preparedness, crisis management, and resilience.Who You Are:Experienced in managing safety and security operations, ideally within a fast-paced technology environment, with a focus on developing security and safety programs and incident response plans.Skilled in managing all aspects of a physical security program, including but not limited to Executive Protection, Event Security, and Travel Security.Experienced in building and growing regional and global safety and security programs to scale with organizational needs.Knowledgeable about global technical security monitoring systems, with experience reviewing architectural plans and planning physical security design.Familiarity with enterprise physical security risk management principles, including conducting security and safety risk assessments and implementing mitigation strategies.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey security information across all levels of the organization with specific focus to executives.Strong vendor management capabilities, with a track record of managing and coordinating with external security vendors.10+ years of experience in corporate physical security and safety roles within a global security environment, with specific expertise in North and South American regions.5+ years as a fulltime people manager is essentialDatadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:Generous and competitive benefits packageNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous career development opportunities Product training to develop understanding of our product and spaceBest in breed onboardingInternal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentallyFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$160,000—$210,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. job_title: GTM Strategy and Operations Analyst - Channels & Alliances
job_description: The GTM Strategy & Operations Analyst - C&A will join a global team driving Datadog’s next phase of growth. We’re interdisciplinary thinkers leveraging diverse business backgrounds in management consulting, investment banking, business development, and tech to accelerate Datadog’s global growth. We work directly with Datadog’s most senior leaders to set corporate strategy, improve efficiency across the business, support data-driven decision-making, own complex operations, and more.As a GTM Strategy & Operations Analyst at Datadog, you will play a pivotal role in driving our GTM team's success globally. You will be tasked with analyzing datasets, synthesizing and communicating insights to drive global strategic go-to-market (GTM) initiatives. You will have the opportunity to not only shape key business decisions but also get into operationalizing programs and drive success of outcomes. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders across sales and cross functional teams to shape and influence global strategic priorities.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits themWhat you’ll do:Analyze sales, channel, and GTM data to identify trends, understand efficiency, and collaborate with leaders to adjust strategies as needed.Build and maintain dashboards to measure against KPIs and deliver actionable insights Contribute to long-term strategy by identifying growth opportunities and optimizing approaches in conjunction with sales/growth targets. Assist in high-priority projects and initiatives within the broader GTM & Strategy teamWho You Are:1-2 years experience preferred in investment banking, management consulting, revenue & growth strategy functions, or equivalent experience as a business analystProficient in performing accurate calculations and analyses with a strong attention to detail Track record of distilling actionable insights from complex dataStrong verbal and written communication skills; capable of synthesizing complex concepts and providing regular updates to senior stakeholders Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, each with unique challenges and stakeholdersAbility to proactively suggest solutions based on the data you are seeing Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:Continuous training and career growthNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase planGenerous and competitive US benefitsFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$75,000—$110,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. title: GTM Strategy and Operations Analyst - Channels & Alliances

job_description: Datadog is looking for an Inclusion Program Manager to help foster a culture of collaboration and belonging for our global teams. In this role, you’ll weave inclusion into our hiring and retention practices, building programs that help Datadogs grow and thrive. You’ll partner with People Ops, Recruiting, Employer Brand, Business Partners, and senior leaders to spot opportunities, share data-driven insights, and drive meaningful impact. We’re looking for someone skilled in data and program management, with a flexible, hands-on approach.This is an individual contributor position reporting into the Senior Director of Internal Communications and Inclusion.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds, and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Develop and implement internal process improvements and programs that foster inclusive hiring and retention.Partner across the organization and with leadership to embed inclusive practices, influence culture, and hold stakeholders accountable.Connect and influence cross-functional Inclusion partners across the business to share program updates, drive change, and advise on actions.Communicate Inclusion programming progress, reinforce accountability, and share recommendations.Analyze data to provide insights and reporting for strategic decision-making that impacts hiring and promotion, measures program impact, and ensures compliance.Establish benchmarks and metrics to measure effectiveness of Inclusion programming.Support the broader Inclusion team with projects as needed, demonstrating strong collaboration skills and stakeholder management.Stay up to date on inclusion trends, best practices, and legal / regulatory developments.Who You Are:5+ years of experience across People and / or Inclusion roles, preferably with experience in fast growing technology companies.A passionate Inclusion subject matter expert with a proven track record of driving impactful Inclusion initiatives in complex organizations, ideally in a rapidly scaling tech company.Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and translate insights into action, with experience in preparing reports and presentations.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage stakeholders effectively.Experienced in communicating and rolling-out changes; shaping, running and measuring programs.Project management experience and ability to influence cross-functional teams.Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:Generous and competitive global benefitsNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase planContinuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and spaceBest in breed onboardingInternal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentallyFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$105,000—$125,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability.
